sections.headline: Simplify Your Business Operations and Data.
sections.subheadline: Replace SaaS subscription models with modern solutions at a fraction of the cost with no long-term commitment

cards.title: Capability Mapping
cards.description: Define what the business must do, who owns it, and what evidence proves it is under control.

cards.title: Workflow Stabilization
cards.description: Reduce spreadsheet dependency and manual stitching by tightening handoffs and clarifying system roles.

cards.title: Modular Replacement
cards.description: Replace one capability at a time with fit-for-purpose tooling that plugs into your operating model.

cards.title: Cutover Governance
cards.description: Run parallel paths, reconciliations, and approvals so leadership can sign off on change with clarity.

sections.title: Capability-by-capability execution with proof at each gate
steps: Map one critical capability with named owners and decision points
Run controlled pilot with parallel reconciliations and rollback triggers
Scale cutover only after evidence meets agreed governance criteria
sections.whyBody: Capability definitions outlive vendors, org charts, and platform choices. Leaders keep control while teams modernize without betting the operation on one big replacement.

phases.title: Capability Assessment
phases.description: Map capability boundaries, ownership, and dependency exposure across systems.

phases.title: Capability Pilot
phases.description: Run ringfenced capability in parallel with reconciliations and rollback criteria.
phases.decision: Approve cutover, extend pilot, or stop safely

phases.title: Controlled Cutover Program
phases.description: Sequence capability cutovers with clear governance gates quarter by quarter.

sections.headline: Replace suite sprawl with governed capabilities
sections.body: If you are stuck between bloated suites and risky full replatforms, we help you take a third path: decompose dependency capability-by-capability with governance and proof.
